Authors:
Sing Tung Teng, Hong Chang Lim, Po Teen Lim, Matthias Wolf,
Chui Pin Leaw
Title:
18S rDNA sequence-only vs. sequence-structure phylogeny: A
case study of Pseudo-nitzschia (Bacillariophyceae)
Keywords:
18S rDNA, 4SALE, alignment, ProfDistS, Pseudo-nitzschia,
secondary structure
Abstract:
We explore the influence of using sequence-only data
vs. sequence-structure data in reconstructing phylogenies. We present a
case study using (1) 18S rDNA primary sequences and (2) 18S rDNA
sequences, and simultaneously their individual secondary structures, to
infer the phylogeny of Pseudo-nitzschia and its relatives. Fifty taxa
classified in the Bacillariophyceae and Fragilariophyceae were analyzed
by distance-based (neighbor-joining, NJ) and character-based (maximum
likelihood, ML) methods, using different substitution models available
for sequence-only and/or sequence-structure data. Four different
analyses were performed using NJ to access the influence of different
substitution models in conjunction with the sequence-structure
information on the phylogenetic inferences. Using sequence-only data or
sequence-structure data yielded different results that are discussed in
relation to morphology. Sequence-structure data revealed more robust
phylogenetic trees that revealed monophyletic clades of morphologically
described species complexes, the P. seriata and the P.
pseudodelicatissima/delicatissima complexes, with more
bootstrap-supported branches.
